[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/admin_service_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Error handling] Does optimize() properly handle Result<bool, Error> failures, or can errors during optimization cause the node to start with invalid admin service configuration? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/admin_service_config.rs] [Integration] [Panic safety] Can any of the config parsing, validation, or application logic panic due to invalid values, causing validator crashes during startup or reconfiguration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/admin_service_config.rs] [Function: default()] [Insecure defaults] Does the default() function at lines 41-50 create an insecure configuration with enabled: None and empty authentication_configs that could be exploited if optimize() is not called? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/admin_service_config.rs] [Function: default()] [Bind address] Why does default() bind to 0.0.0.0 (all interfaces) instead of 127.0.0.1 (localhost only), creating potential remote exposure even when authentication is configured? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/admin_service_config.rs] [Function: default()] [Port conflict] Can the default port 9102 at line 46 conflict with other common services, causing silent failures where operators think admin service is running but it's not? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/admin_service_config.rs] [Function: optimize()] [Node type ignored] Similarly, why does optimize() ignore _node_type at line 88 - should validators have stricter admin service restrictions than full nodes? (Medium)
